snippet: When a German promoter this week brought the spectacle of professional boxing to Kabul, the only real question for many Afghans was what took so long.
abstract: Kabul Journal; Afghans respond with enthusiasm to victory of Hamid Rahimi, German of Afghan descent, over Tanzanian Said Mbwela in World Boxing Organization middleweight title held in Kabul; match, departure from other professional sporting events held in Afghanistan in that it is marketed towards Afghans instead of Westerners, provides much-needed distraction from war raging in country.
lead_paragraph: When a German promoter this week brought the spectacle of professional boxing to Kabul, the only real question for many Afghans was what took so long.

headline.seo: Kabul Boxing Match Draws Cheering Throngs
headline.main: In This Corner, a Much-Needed Distraction
headline.print_headline: In This Corner, a Much-Needed Distraction
